intro: Timonius panayensis, commonly known as the Panay timonius, is a rare flowering plant endemic to the island of Panay in the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a critically endangered species.
